Module com.sudoku
Package com.sudoku.model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
com.sudoku.model.Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
IBoard
public class Board extends Object implements IBoard
Represents the logical structure of a 6×6 Sudoku board.

This class builds the Sudoku board as a tree-like structure: the root node contains 6 section nodes (blocks), and each section node contains 6 cell nodes. Each node is represented by a Node object with a unique float ID.

Example structure:

 Root (0.0)
 ├── Section 1 (1.0)
 │   ├── Cell 1 (1.1)
 │   ├── Cell 2 (1.2)
 │   └── ...
 ├── Section 2 (2.0)
 │   ├── Cell 1 (2.1)
 │   └── ...

The board automatically generates a valid Sudoku solution using SudokuGenerator, and then randomly fills two initial values per section as clues.

      public Board()
      Constructs a Sudoku board.
      • Creates an empty hierarchical structure (sections and cells).
      • Fills two random valid values per section as initial clues.

    • setNodeValue

      protected void setNodeValue(Float fatherId, Float childId, String value)
      Sets the value of a cell node directly by section and child ID. This is a protected helper method used internally, for example, during initialization.
      Parameters:
      fatherId - the section ID
      childId - the cell ID
      value - the value to assign

    • validateInput

      protected boolean validateInput(Float fatherId, Float childId, String value)
      Validates an input value according to Sudoku rules:
      • No repetition in the same section (block).
      • No repetition in the same column.
      • No repetition in the same row.
      This is a protected helper method for internal validation.
      Parameters:
      fatherId - the section ID
      childId - the cell ID
      value - the value to validate
      Returns:
      true if the value is valid, otherwise false

    • validateInput

      public boolean validateInput(String textFieldId)
      Validates the value of a cell using its TextField ID. This method is part of the IBoard interface.
      • No repetition in the same section (block).
      • No repetition in the same column.
      • No repetition in the same row.
      Specified by:
      validateInput in interface IBoard
      Parameters:
      textFieldId - the TextField ID (e.g., "t13")
      Returns:
      true if the value does not violate Sudoku rules

      public boolean isSudokuCompleteAndValid()
      Checks if the Sudoku board is completely filled and all values are valid.
      Specified by:
